channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Parking issues, 6th December
item.description:
We have raised numerous complaints around the parking on clockhouse road when the CPZ ends at midday the road is full and makes resident parking impossible its worse at weekends complaints are just ignored by Bromley council and its councilors this is unfair on residents who pay for a permit and the area needs to be reviewed and the current times adjusted tje traffic and parking has got worse over the years.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clock House Road, Elmers End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin full and rubbish in hedge, 6th December
item.description:
Can the bin please be emptied and rubbish in the hedge behind be picked up? I have seen Rats in the area around here. If this isn't done I will escalate to the MP in our area as this has been ongoing for over a year now.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Shooters Hill, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car has driven over the traffic island opposite 122 College Road, SE19., 6th December
item.description:
There is a small traffic island on the road opposite 122 College Road, SE19. A car drove over this island last week and destroyed the yellow reflective sign and the red and white sign behind it. The island is not lit. It divides the road from the cycle lane. Subsequently, another car drove over this island last night (5/12). The island is a danger to vehicles, as it is potentially in the way of non-attentive drivers. I would repair the traffic furniture as a matter of urgency. Two vehicles have already hit it this last week.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): College Road, Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Residents are dumping waste in the pavement and not using bins. This is a health hazard and creates litter mess along the street, 6th December
item.description:
The residents are not using the bins in the bin store and are dumping their rubbish sacks on the pavement including bags with food waste. This is creating a health hazard and mess along the street. There is a persistent problem with this block of flats.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Martaban Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The overhanging vegetation is significantly obstructing the pavement., 6th December
item.description:
The branches extend low over the footway, making it impossible for pedestrians to pass safely and forcing people to move into the road. It is incredible dangerous for anyone with a buggy, wheelchair or suitcase. The problem is so severe that the branches will soon impact passing vehicles. This has been an ongoing issue for quite some time.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parkside Avenue, Southborough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 3 foot wide pothole on College Road, SE19, opposite 122/124 College Road, 6th December
item.description:
This pothole was filled as a temporary measure in July 2024. It has now reappeared. In my view, it is a problem for cars and the 450 buses, many of whose wheels pass straight over it. To be clear, there is once again a notable dip in the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): College Road, Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Van abandoned, 6th December
item.description:
DU70XGF van been dumped outside my house for over 2 weeks. Am 91 years old and I need space outside my house to get in to taxi my walking poor and I really struggle. The van has not been moved for 2 weeks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Maiden Lane, Barnes Cray, Greater London
